question.title: App built with Eclipse 4.37 Components, Run From Jar, gets "Libraries for platform win32 cannot be loaded because of incompatible environment" error
question.body:
I am updating an app that uses the Eclipse components (SWT, JFace, etc) to use the Eclipse version 4.37 components.

The old version didn't use Maven, the new version does.

My problem is, while I can run and debug the app, I can't run it from the .jar that I'm building, which is how users will run the app.

I run it from the jar file as follows:

java --enable-native-access=ALL-UNNAMED -verbose:jni -jar {jar file path}

This command gets this error message:

"Libraries for platform win32 cannot be loaded because of incompatible environment"

I am running on 64-bit Windows.

When I debug the jar, it stops on breakpoints in my main method. But it terminates the moment I access the Display class. The app terminates. If I put the Display access in a try/catch, the catch is never executed.

My pom.xml:

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <groupId>com.ericbt</groupId>
    <artifactId>vault3</artifactId>
    <version>1</version>

    <properties>
        <eclipse-platform>org.eclipse.platform</eclipse-platform>
        <osgi.platform>win32.win32.x86_64</osgi.platform>
        <maven.compiler.release>24</maven.compiler.release>
    </properties>

    <build>
        <resources>
            <resource>
                <directory>${project.basedir}/src/mainPackage/resources</directory>
                <targetPath>resources</targetPath> <!-- Optional: Specify the path inside the JAR -->
                <includes>
                    <include>**/*</include> <!-- Include all files and subfolders -->
                </includes>
                <excludes>
                    <exclude>artwork</exclude>
                </excludes>
            </resource>
        </resources>
        <sourceDirectory>${project.basedir}/src</sourceDirectory>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.14.1</version> <!-- Use a recent version -->
                <configuration>
                    <source>${maven.compiler.release}</source>
                    <target>24</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-shade-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.6.1</version> <!-- Use a recent version -->
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>shade</goal>
                        </goals>
                        <configuration>
                            <filters>
                                <filter>
                                    <artifact>*:*</artifact>
                                    <excludes>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.SF</exclude>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.DSA</exclude>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.RSA</exclude>
                                    </excludes>
                                </filter>
                            </filters>
                            <transformers>
                                <transformer implementation="org.apache.maven.plugins.shade.resource.ManifestResourceTransformer">
                                    <mainClass>mainPackage.MainApplicationWindow</mainClass> <!-- Replace with your main class -->
                                </transformer>
                            </transformers>
                        </configuration>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-resources-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.3.1</version> <!-- Use a recent version -->
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>

    <!-- Eclipse 4.37 components, released 2025-09-05 -->
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.swt.${osgi.platform}</artifactId>
            <version>3.131.0</version>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.swt.svg</artifactId>
            <version>3.130.100</version>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.e4.core.commands</artifactId>
            <version>1.1.600</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.core.runtime</artifactId>
            <version>3.34.0</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.equinox.common</artifactId>
            <version>3.20.200</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.jface.text</artifactId>
            <version>3.28.100</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.jface</artifactId>
            <version>3.38.0</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.osgi</artifactId>
            <version>3.23.200</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>${eclipse-platform}</groupId>
            <artifactId>org.eclipse.text</artifactId>
            <version>3.14.400</version>
        </dependency>

        <!--
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.github.weisj</groupId>
            <artifactId>jsvg</artifactId>
            <version>1.7.2</version>
        </dependency>
        -->

        <!-- local .jar files -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.example</groupId>
            <artifactId>imgscalr-lib</artifactId>
            <version>1.0.0</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.example</groupId>
            <artifactId>sqlite-jdbc</artifactId>
            <version>1.0.0</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.13.2</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.example</groupId>
            <artifactId>common-code</artifactId>
            <version>1.0.0</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.example</groupId>
            <artifactId>perf4j</artifactId>
            <version>1.0.0</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.example</groupId>
            <artifactId>itextpdf</artifactId>
            <version>1.0.0</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
</project>

Note: The com.github.weisj is commented out, but I still see it in the jar. Maven must be picking it up as a transitive dependency.

Do you have any suggestions for how I can troubleshoot?

answers.body:
I got a similar problem and eventually found that it was idiot user.

Using maven surefire for standalone testing, A code change to the startup conditionalization so that a Display was created leading to a variety of UI in non-UI conflicts.

Confusingly, debugging on Jenkins (Linux) maven surefire uses the win32 swt not the linux swt leading to investigation of the wrong swt. It would be less confusing if the redundant UI support on Jenkins used linux swt and so reported an error such as:

Libraries for platform linux cannot be loaded because of incompatible environment

Moral: do not activate UI code in a non-UI application.
